text.p: Perpetual Trustee Co Ltd said on Tuesday it hoped to achieve growth in net profit for the year ended June 30, 1997 compared with the previous year.

"The Australian economy has a history of being rather frail and fickle, but given reasonable performance of the economy and continuing good management from our staff and executives, we would hope to end the financial year with a good increase an last year's annual profit," Perpetual said.
Perpetual reported a net profit of A$11.76 million in the six months to December 31, up from A$6.29 million a year earlier.
"Our improved performance during the first half of this financial year resulted from strong revenue growth as well as continued careful management of costs," Perpetual said.
Perpetual shares closed five cents up at A$7.55.
